I would like to register a complaint about the HomeTown Buffet in Sandy, and their lack of rotating their food and maintaining correct temperatures.  I worked for food service for 28 year's, in Idaho, and we were required to maintain correct temperatures on both hot and cold food, and rotate food frequently.  When we were in this establishment, the temperature of the food was not checked, and the food was neither rotated or stirred to maintain it's quality.  Are food service employee's in Utah not required to use gloves when handling or serving food?  The food was encrusted on the sides of the container's, and the mayo had turned dark yellow from being under the heat lamp's too long.  We were there on a Sunday afternoon at 1:00 p.m., so it should have been busy for Sunday Dinner, but the store was almost empty, and therefore the food was not being properly cared for.  The kitchen manager, Keith Atwood, wouldn't even take a look at the food when a complaint was lodged.

I was an employee at Kneaders recently, and there have been problems with cleanliness since day one. The dishwasher (sanitizer) is drained and cleared out (of food that the screen catches) once or twice per day. It is supposed to be cleared out once every 4 hours, if I remember correctly. 

There are constantly crumbs and sometimes pieces of food in the clean dish bins. These get washed every few weeks when someone finally thinks it's bad enough. 

The buckets used for sanitizer solution rarely get cleaned. The water is changed fairly often, but there is a black film on the inside of most of the buckets. 

Dishes are not washed properly. Every employee there will just rinse out a bowl or utensil, then proceed to use it for something else. Dishes are put back on the shelves after being rinsed as well. Soap and sanitizer have never been used for dishes, as far as I've seen. They just use the pressure sprayer. On several occasions, I've seen brownie pans reused while still having food residue from cinnamon rolls and/or brownies.

Shucked shellfish are holding at 58  F.  No sanitizer is available. No sanitizer test paper strips are available.  Hot /cold holding equipment is not working. Employees are not washing hands. 
The operation was closed down.  Murray police dispatcher was called to assist.  Consultation phone calls were made to Richard Clark and Jay S. at Utah Department of Agriculture and Food.   The operator had requested to store his food in the freezers at Seoul Market. UDAF declined, because of opened containers, unapproved source, and transportation in the unrefrigerated U-Haul truck from Calfornia, said to take at least 11 hours. I asked the cashier if they could remake the pizza, the cashier replied that they wash their hands; I explained to her what I saw, and told her that he needed to wear gloves to touch RTE food.  She said that because he was working in the line, he didnt need to. I told her that I work for the Health Department and taught the ServSafe classes, so I knew the regulations. The manager came out, threw the pizza on the counter and asked for my name, she wanted to contact our bureau manager to confirm, if I did work for the Health Department. She said that according to regulation the guy boxing the pizza didnt have to wear gloves, and she denied that he had bare hand contact with the pizza. 139418	605	37	11/7/2016 22:00	11/8/2016 13:57	2	1	ANON	ANON						My husband and I went into the KFC and ordered some chicken strips and mashed potatoes w/ gravy. The gentleman that helped us took our order and then a man that was behind us. After, he immediately ran behind the counter and started getting food ready. He did not wash his hands or put gloves on. He put a sauce bottle on the counter that was almost empty. He ran to the back and returned with a large bag of sauce. He tried to open the bag with his hands and when it didn't open, he put the bag in his mouth and tore it open. I could not believe what I was seeing. I asked my husband if it was really happening. He said that it was. He wanted to storm out he was so angry. I told him that I wanted to get a refund. The man put the contents of the bag in the container and he poured it on my food. He then came around to give me my food and I asked him for a refund. He asked if we could tell him why. My husband was so furious and yelled that he saw him open the bag with his mouth and asked if they didn't have a knife or scissors that he could have opened it with. The man said that he was really sorry about that" and went to get us our refund. My husband asked for the managers information. The man said that he was the manager. He did not have a name tag on so we didn't get that information. We told him that we would be filing a complaint with the health department as we were deeply disturbed with the situation. I feel for those that went there after and were exposed to whatever germs/contaminates. I have filed a complaint with KFC as well, but I really feel this needs to be looked into. Way too many health violations for the few minutes we were in there.
